results.title: The Fang
results.material_description: Single channel moving image, colour and audio
results.brief_description: The Fang is an animation that uses the animated contributions of past AIM students. Produced and directed by Al MacInnes with the song performed by his band Dan and Al, the Fang celebrates and displays the vast animation techniques and styles used by Al’s peers. The Fang himself is a character around town who wonders what the fang is and discovers that he is the fang, a very much sort after man.

results.title: A Bill of Divorcement cinema slide
results.creator_credit: George Cukor and RKO Radio Pictures
results.credit_line: ACMI has endeavoured to contact the owners of these objects since their deposit in 2015. Unfortunately this has been unsuccessful. We would welcome any information to identify the owners.
results.brief_description: Slide imagery with a monochromatic emulsion that has then been hand painted with coloured pigments or dye. TEXT on the slide reads: RKO Radio Pictures presents John Barrymore in A Bill of Divorcement A play that ran a solid year in London and New York with Katharine Hepburn Billie Bourk David Manners Barrymore in the biggest story and finest part of his brilliant career.
results.description: Slide imagery with a monochromatic emulsion that has then been hand painted with coloured pigments or dye. results.title: Ginger cinema slide
results.creator_credit: Lewis Seiler and Fox Film Corporation
results.credit_line: ACMI has endeavoured to contact the owners of these objects since their deposit in 2015. Unfortunately this has been unsuccessful. We would welcome any information to identify the owners.
results.brief_description: Two glass sheets: one glass only and the other with slide imagery which has a monochromatic emulsion that has then been hand painted with coloured pigments or dye. TEXT on the slide reads: A lovable Spitfire Ginger with Jane Withers and Jackie Searl Gunn Slide for General Exhibition The two sheets of glass are held together using Gunn’s Slide branded tape: Gunn’s Slide, 9 Collins Place Melb. Cent. 2736,

results.title: Darn tootin'
results.brief_description: A 2D hand-drawn animation, ‘Darn tootin’ is a spoof on the masculiny of cowboys depicted in Westerns. The animation has many mixed references…An American accented cowboy rides into town and says hello to a cross-dressing Aussie accented blacksmith. Another American cowboy asks him for a drink, the two walk hand in hand into the saloon (USA pub) bearing a sign reading No Singlets, No thongs (an Australian reference). The foley used throughout places the ‘Western’ town in Australia with the sounds of Australian birds.

results.title: The Grifters
results.creator_credit: Cineplex Odeon Films, Martin Scorsese, Robert A. Harris, Jim Painten and Stephen Frears
results.brief_description: Set in the sleazy horse-tracks and gambling dens of contemporary L.A., “The Grifters” is a modern crime film that compares favourably to classic Hollywood film-noir films. Based on Jim Thompson’s pulp classic of the same name, this film shimmers with a consistent erotic tension. John Cusack is Roy, a young con-man who makes easy money off the gullible hordes that crowd Los Angeles. He finds himself caught in the middle of a dangerous tug-of-war between his prostitute girlfriend (Annette Bening) who wants him to committ a major scam, and his elegant but desperate mother, Lily (Angelica Huston), who has been hustling for years and wants to find a way out. Both are powerful women not adverse to using the people they love to get what they want, and their desperate machinations to achieve financial independance puts Roy’s very life at risk. This brilliantly directed film is a powerful study on the corrosive effects of power and money on human relationships. All the cast is outstanding but special mention must be made of the majestic Angelica Huston: her blazing and frightening performance as Lily is unforgettable.

results.title: British Agent cinema slide
results.creator_credit: Michael Curtiz and Warner Brothers First National Productions
results.credit_line: ACMI has endeavoured to contact the owners of these objects since their deposit in 2015. Unfortunately this has been unsuccessful. We would welcome any information to identify the owners.
results.brief_description:
Two glass sheets: one glass only and the other with slide imagery which has a monochromatic emulsion that has then been hand painted with coloured pigments or dye. Kay Francis Lesley Francis
It was said to be: “Too intimate to be printed!” “Too daring to be filmed!” British Agent Gunn Slide Not suitable for general exhibition On the front glass slide there is worn away hand writing: Monday matinee

results.title: The Greatest show on Earth
results.creator_credit: Paramount Pictures and Cecil B. DeMille
results.brief_description: Cecil B. DeMille blended drama with spectacle, using the Ringling Bros. Barnum & Bailey Circus as a backdrop. The film is a behind-the- scenes look at the triumphs and conflicts of circus performers. The magic and thrill of life under the Big Top is stunningly recreated. The all-star cast includes Betty Hutton, Cornel Wilde, Charlton Heston, Dorothy Lamour and James Stewart as “Buttons the Clown”. Filled with romance, intrigue and high-flying acrobatics, “The Greatest Show on Earth” is exactly that.

results.title: All ears
results.creator_credit: Ben McGill, David Atkinson, Robyn Blake, Bruce McGill, Jeane McGill, Sunny McGill and Jeremy Parker
results.brief_description: A short claymation about an old man whose quiet ‘memory filled’ days are rudely interrupted by a pushy salesman. As the old man contently potters around his flat faintly hearing the outside world he is bombarded by the overbearing hard-sell tactics of a salesman selling hearing aids.

TEXT on the slide reads: Go gloriously mad with the Vagabond Trio Kay Francis Living on Velvet with Warren William & George Brent Not suitable for general exhibition.
